channel.title: About on Auke Rijpma
channel.description: Recent content in About on Auke Rijpma

item.title: Data
item.description: Data Church construction data A dataset on church construction in Western Europe, 700–1500, based on OpenStreetMap. 🗺 ⛪ Licence (following the OSM source licence). Full repository. Frequently requested slices: Western Europe series Western Europe by type of church Western Europe by city geography By country Todd/Murdock data A dataset on historical family characteristics around the globe :world:. Data More info and citation: Rijpma, Auke, and Sarah G.

item.title: Links and projects

item.title: Publications
item.description: Publications ‘Retracing Hotbeds of the 1918–19 Influenza Pandemic. Spatial Differences in Seasonal Excess Mortality in the Netherlands’, with with Rick Mourits, Ruben Schalk, Albert Meroño-Peñuela, Joe Raad, Bram van den Hout, and Richard L. Zijdeman. Historical Life Course Studies 10 (March 2021). pdf Rijpma, Auke. “A Composite View on Inequality and Well-Being.” In How Was Life? Volume II, edited by Jan Luiten Van Zanden, Marco Mira d’Ercole, Mikołaj Malinowski, and Auke Rijpma.

item.title: Working papers
item.description: Working papers Pim de Zwart, Daniel Gallardo, and Auke Rijpma (2020). “The Demographic Effects of a Colonial Institution: Forced Cultivation and Mortality in Java, 1830–1880”. Ruben Schalk and Auke Rijpma (2019). “Migration for necessity or proficiency: The Netherlands, 1750-1920”. Auke Rijpma, Jan Luiten van Zanden, and Marco Mira d’Ercole (2018). “A Long-Term Perspective on the Development Experience of Emerging and Industrialised Economies”. OECD Statistics Working Papers 2018/10. Auke Rijpma (2016). “What Can’t Money Buy?
